comments: In my opinion, Kevin was a pretty bad prof. His lectures were really slow and confusing. When students asked questions, he wouldn\'t know how to answer or he would go on about something completely off topic. At times, he would contradict himself too. During office hours, he was quite sarcastic and didn\'t seem like he wanted to help.

comments: He goes slow through the material. Pauses class for 3 minutes at a time and usually doesn\'t get any questions. Spends time doing useless proofs. Monotone, boring. comments: Very interesting prof to listen to, lectures were always fun and also put an emphasis on us understanding the material instead of just plowing through the course. Excellent prof.

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (2)  Hilarious (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Get ready to read (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Great prof, keeps you engaged and tries hard to make a tough class easier. Honestly warned us about hard assignments and tests. Gives lots of examples for the theory he teaches. Sometimes what he\'s doing seems a bit like magic, but if you think about it a little bit it makes sense. Made me enjoy the course I dreaded! =)

comments: A truly fantastic professor. The (weekly) assignments were very difficult, but the exams weren\'t too bad. A construction of the exterior algebra isn\'t something you see too often in second year. =)

tag_professor: TEST HEAVY (2)  Hilarious (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Get ready to read (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: I found this to be the hardest advanced math course. The weekly assignments took a lot of time to do. It was hard to keep up with the material, and getting good marks required a lot of work. On the other hand, I really enjoyed the course - this is one of the courses that taught me the most in UW so far. Well Done.
